problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous lecture video clips.
Which of the following are true?

choice.text: The Gottesman-Knill theorem works because the amount of entanglement created by a Clifford operation is small.
The Gottesman-Knill theorem works because the number of possible Pauli operations on [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] qubits is a polynomial in [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline].

In the Gottesman-Knill theorem for a Clifford circuit of size [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] on [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] qubits we can keep track of stabilizer generators by [mathjaxinline]O(nT)[/mathjaxinline] number of operations.
In order to simulate the measurement outcome of all [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] qubits we need [mathjaxinline]O(n^2)[/mathjaxinline] classical operations.
